p: The criteria for clinical HFMD diagnosis was consistent with Chinese guidelines for the diagnosis and treatment of HFMD [ 1]. Mild HFMD cases were defined as patients having oral ulcers and maculopapular or vesicular rashes on their hands, feet, and buttocks, with or without fever. Severe HFMD cases were defined as HFMD accompanied by at least one of the following neurological and cardiopulmonary complications: aseptic meningitis, encephalitis, encephalomyelitis, acute flaccid paralysis, autonomic nervous system dysregulation, pulmonary oedema, pulmonary haemorrhage, and cardiorespiratory failure.
